overview:
David Schaller joined CenterPoint as a Venture Partner in September 2002 and has been a Managing Director since 2006. He currently serves as a Director or Observer on the Boards of ExteNet Systems, Handango, and InGrid; and has worked with AppTrigger and Chorum.

Prior to his involvement in venture capital, Dave co-founded three venture backed companies. He was an initial co-founder of BizRate.com/Shopzilla.com (sold to E.W. Scripps) and was a co-founder, Director, and EVP-U.S. Operations for OraMetrix, a CenterPoint Ventures Fund I company. Additionally, Dave was a co-founder and the Chairman of Light Biology (merged with Nimblegen Systems).

Prior to his entrepreneurial experience, Dave was a consultant with The Boston Consulting Group. He focused on clients in health care, software, and communication services. He was on the launching team of Williams Communications businessâ€™ and nationwide fiber optic network in 1997. David spent the early years of his career in sales and marketing at the Dow Chemical Company. He holds a B.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Cincinnati and an M.B.A. degree with Distinction from The Wharton Graduate School of Business, where he was also named a Palmer Scholar.
